question: Which Indian sportsperson won the inaugural ‘BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year award’?
explanation:
Indian ace badminton player PV Sindhu won the inaugural BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year award after a public vote. Sindhu became the first Indian to win badminton World Championship gold in 2019.
The five nominations for the award include sprinter Dutee Chand, boxer Mary Kom, wrestler Vinesh Phogat and para-badminton player Manasi Joshi. Former sprinter PT Usha was given the Lifetime Achievement award for her contribution to Indian sports.
